data.title: Add column_title_pressed signal to Tree node
data.body:
The Tree node column/table form is missing the ability to capture column title presses easily via a signal.

This PR will make implementing table operations such as 'sort by column title' much simpler to invoke.

[Godot QA ref](https://godotengine.org/qa/7699)

data.title: Added ObjC entry into .clang-format
data.body: Just duplicated the definitions for CPP to be accepted for Objective C. Seems to work fine. Without this clang 5 kept changing tabs into spaces...

data.title: Sorting projects in Project List inside Project Manager
data.body:
This is a feature proposal.
There is a neat favorite feature in Project List inside the Project Manager (with the Stars to the left of project names) but it would be awesome if we could also sort the Project List by alphabetical name or reverse the order. It could be sorted for Paths too.
Anyway, just an idea for improvement.

data.title: fix varying in 3.0 shader
data.body:
shader varying is not working.
this add a "m_" to varying variable

Fixes #8749.

data.title: [FP] Indicate if a project is missing rather than deleting it from the project list
data.body:
I've noticed that Godot automatically removes unavailable projects from the project list. While this makes sense for deleted projects, it can be a bit of a pain if they are residing on removable media, mounted sshfs/sftp connections, network shares etc. which were not mounted at the time Godot was opened.

What I am thinking could happen is on every run Godot should check to see if the project is not there and then mark it as missing in the GUI and display a message when the user attempts to run or edit the project. (e.g `The project at <project path> is currently unavailable or unreadable. Check the path and try again.`)

Additionally the message could give the user the option of removing the project from the list should they desire to.

data.title: GDScript classes can be replaced by anything
data.body:
The following code works:

```gdscript
	Sprite = 42
	print(Sprite)
```

And effectiveley replaces `Sprite` as if it was a normal global variable.
It looks like a bug, and a way to troll a game project really hard^^
Someone (maybe accidentally) did that in a QA thread: https://godotengine.org/qa/14991/extention-add_exception-nonexistent-function-add_exception

Might be related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6221

data.title: Android Export or Debug Mode Remained on refresh screen
data.body: This Error I have a problem when exporting or running directly in debug mode, it happens in my games while I'm not in demo games. I've been struggling to fix it. I'm dealing with project settings and scene loading scripts.

data.title: Editor: Make "open 2d/3d/script editor" shortcuts configurable.
data.body: Also adds a shortcut for opening the AssetLib (defaulting to F4).

data.title: Reparenting a Node while maintaining transformation
Expose wheel's contact to GDScript and set roll influence in editor [2.1]
data.body:
This PR aims to increase moddability of the vehicle body.

1) It allows GDScript to read the raycast variable that checks if the wheel touches the ground. This allows users to use scripting to vary game behavior depending on whether the car is on ground or in air (e.g. don't handle input at all if we're in air or apply smaller force or smaller steering or whatever)

2) You can now set the roll_influence variable in editor. The smaller the value, the smaller the roll the car body experiences in turns. 0.1 is still the default value, but you can now set a larger value (for even greater roll) or smaller (for roll that is only cosmetic and doesn't threaten rollover).
This is especially important if someone wants different kinds of cars that behave differently wrt roll (e.g. a pickup truck vs a minicar vs a sports car)

EDIT: Made for 2.1. but easily pickable into master (by someone who actually can cherry pick as opposed to me)

data.title: Fix weigth scale of A* being applied to the whole estimation
data.body:
Attempt to fix #8584.

Would be nice if someone with A* knowledge can confirm that this is correct.

This should be backported to 2.x in case it is merged.

data.title: Added support to be able to inherit from SpatialMaterial in C++
data.body:
Added support to be able to inherit from SpatialMaterial in C++.
See Issue #8767.

Some notes:
-Changes to MaterialKey so the class info is included in the comparison
-Broke up _update_shader into _get_shader_string, _get_shader_parameters_string, _get_shader_vertex_string and _get_shader_fragment_string and made protected to allow modification of shader code by inheriting classes


My sample code that uses these changes:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_nQZvJoqbFmY01sVHlmb21ZTEE

data.title: Add trim_trailing_whitespace to .editorconfig
Fix for..in range() resulting in floats instead of ints
change shader variable TIME's type to vec4
data.body: TIME in gles3 ubo_data is a vec4

data.title: int number will change to a real number when [for i in range(10):]
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
master [76289b5]

**Issue description:**
range(int) will change to range(real) if it after for


**Steps to reproduce:**

```
var a = range(10)
for i in a:
  print(typeof(i))
```
print 2 -> is int number

but

```
for i in range(10):
  print(typeof(i))
```

print 3 ->is real number

data.title: SamplePlayer2D has invalid mix rate when parented to a Viewport node
data.body:
Tested on 2 PCs:
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1.3 x64
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1.3 x32
Windows 10 x64 - Godot 2.1.2
Windows 7 - Godot 2.1.2

SamplePlayer2D plays only full volume, non-spatial sound. It also does not stop playback after calling stop_all(). Found very little on SoundPlayer2D so maybe it works for most people and I do something wrong way. Every sound I played so far was accompanied by the message:
```
ERROR: SpatialSound2DServerSW::update: Invalid mix rate for voice (0) check for invalid pitch_scale param.
   At: servers\spatial_sound_2d\spatial_sound_2d_server_sw.cpp:952
```
Seems similar to [this old issue](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/747).

Minimal project [here](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1002260/soundtest.zip). Should display the sound source at the cursor position and attenuate the sound based on this position.

data.title: Grey rendering on Mesa/Radeon (Translation from TGSI failed)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian testing - Godot 3.0 - Mesa 17.1 - AMD Radeon HD 6670
[glxinfo.txt](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1001722/glxinfo.txt) (OpenGL Core Profile 3.3)

**Issue description:**
Everything 3D is rendered grey and the terminal shows a lot of this errors:
```
EE ../../../../../src/gallium/drivers/r600/r600_shader.c:183 r600_pipe_shader_create - translation from TGSI failed !
EE ../../../../../src/gallium/drivers/r600/r600_state_common.c:800 r600_shader_select - Failed to build shader variant (type=1) -1
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open any 3d scene, even the testcube is enough.

data.title: Inconsistent File.file_exists(path) values through Desktop/Android
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Android

**Issue description:**
On Android, File.file_exists(path) returns false for a scene resource. On Desktop I got that it exists.  ResourceLoader is able to load the path on both plataforms. ResourceLoader.has(path) returns True on both platforms.

I think File.file_exists(path) is not able to access `res://` path on Android, and that's why it always return false.

On the other hand, ResourceLoader.has(path) is inconsistent through desktop/android. As for Android, it seems to have the files on it's cache no matter if the file is loaded into memory or not.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Run `File.file_exists` over a path with `res://` prefix that you already know it exists and print in console. Deploy to Android and see logs. You will see print results tells you that file does not exist.
```
print('Path exists: ', File.new().file_exists(path))
```

data.title: [3.0] MeshDataTool returns incorrect normals
data.body:
MeshDataTool is returning incorrect normals in godot 3. Godot 2 works correctly.

I have a sample project here which demonstrates the problem:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_nQZvJoqbFmQzQ5TmptNDU4OTg

Open Test-Cube.tscn in godot 3 and run the scene and it spits out to console:

```
normal[0] = (-1, 0.011765, -1)
normal[1] = (-1, 0.011765, -1)
normal[2] = (-1, 0.011765, -1)
normal[3] = (-1, -0.003922, -1)
normal[4] = (-1, -0.003922, -1)
normal[5] = (-1, -0.003922, -1)
normal[6] = (-0.003922, -1, -1)
normal[7] = (-0.003922, -1, -1)
normal[8] = (-0.003922, -1, -1)
normal[9] = (-1, -1, -0.003922)
normal[10] = (-1, -1, -0.003922)
normal[11] = (-1, -1, -0.003922)
normal[12] = (0.011765, -1, -1)
normal[13] = (0.011765, -1, -1)
normal[14] = (0.011765, -1, -1)
normal[15] = (-1, -1, 0.011765)
normal[16] = (-1, -1, 0.011765)
normal[17] = (-1, -1, 0.011765)
normal[18] = (-1, 0.011765, -1)
normal[19] = (-1, -0.003922, -1)
normal[20] = (-0.003922, -1, -1)
normal[21] = (-1, -1, -0.003922)
normal[22] = (0.011765, -1, -1)
normal[23] = (-1, -1, 0.011765)
```

open Test-Cube-2.tscn in godot 2 and it outputs to console:

```
normal[0] = (0, -1, 0)
normal[1] = (0, -1, 0)
normal[2] = (0, -1, 0)
normal[3] = (0, -1, 0)
normal[4] = (0, 1, 0)
normal[5] = (0, 1, 0)
normal[6] = (0, 1, 0)
normal[7] = (0, 1, 0)
normal[8] = (1, 0, 0)
normal[9] = (1, 0, 0)
normal[10] = (1, 0, 0)
normal[11] = (1, 0, 0)
normal[12] = (-0, -0, 1)
normal[13] = (-0, -0, 1)
normal[14] = (-0, -0, 1)
normal[15] = (-0, -0, 1)
normal[16] = (-1, -0, -0)
normal[17] = (-1, -0, -0)
normal[18] = (-1, -0, -0)
normal[19] = (-1, -0, -0)
normal[20] = (0, 0, -1)
normal[21] = (0, 0, -1)
normal[22] = (0, 0, -1)
normal[23] = (0, 0, -1) 
```

I have a hunch that if reading normals is wrong, writing them may also be wrong.

data.title: Power/Battery management
data.body:
This issue keeps track of current implementation of battery/power management in Godot. 
For reference, #314 

The code is ready to welcome implementations for all missing platforms (classes and methods ready but return a warning - not implemented on this platform)

Platforms:
- [ ] Android : needs testing
The code is directly adaptated from SDL to using Godot API. It probably diserves more attention.
- [ ] Haiku : not developed
- [ ] Iphone : not developed
- [ ] Javascript : not developed
Waiting for more information & specs
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Battery_Status_API
https://w3c.github.io/battery/

- [ ] OSX : needs testing
- [ ] Server : partially tested, but shows obvious code flaws
- [ ] UWP : not developed
This could be of use https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/devices-sensors/get-battery-info
- [ ] Windows : needs testing
- [ ] X11 : partially tested, but shows obvious code flaws

edit: adding a test project that may be used on every platform.
[godot-power-test.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1178139/godot-power-test.zip)

data.title: Cannot un-highlight text in the output dialog box

 It's a trivial, but somewhat annoying bug. After you highlight some text in the Output box located beneath the viewport, you cannot un-highlight it.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Pretty straight forward, highlight some text in the Ouput box and then try un-highlighting it.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->
Not necessary

data.title: [3.0] Extending SpatialMaterial
data.body:
I want to extend the functionality of the built in material class in C++. There are a few things that are stopping me doing this, particularly - none of the methods are virtual, especially _update_shader

I want to make a terrain material that takes extra textures so being able to override set/get texture would be helpful if these were also virtual. 

If this is something that the godot team are interested in I might do a fork and make some engine changes and commit them back.
